Row.Text: I am Justinian I, Emperor of Byzantium. I expect you've come to witness the final sanctury of Rome? Well, you've found it.
Greetings. I am Justinian I, Emperor of Byzantium. Have you come to borrow some of my law books? Or to take part in my arena perhaps? Or shall we stroll the training yards?
Your quest for Rome is noble. But I assure you, God has blessed me with this charge, not you. I trust that you will not get in my way.
My beauty, it seems we are destined to compete with one another. I will only seek to make you proud, of course.
My armies may lie defeated, but the fires that inspired me to seek out Rome will not be extinguished.
What will you do now? Will you pursue the dream that you have taken from me?
I bow humbly to the greater Caesar.
Then I will take my rightful place at your side.
Back so soon?
You mustn't have much going on.
Are you trying to annoy me? Or do you really have something to say this time?
Didn't I already say you would have to do better?
I already told you to only bother offering a fair deal.
Hello friend. What brings you to my court?
Greetings.
What do you want?
Do you submit?
Have you come to bend your knee to me?
Always a pleasure working with you, friend. What brings you to my court?
How's your little war going? Hopefully not too well. What do you want?
I pray for your victory in your current conflict. Now, how may I serve you?
I have battled a hundred fools like you before. Don't think you intimidate me with your forces at my borders.
I trust you won't do anything foolish with an army so close to my borders?
I am tired of seeing your people spreading around the land like a plague. When do you think they'll die out?

It's come to my attention that your recent expansion is into lands very close to my own. I wanted to warn you about this before I resorted to... well, let's leave it at that, shall we? What would you like to discuss?
Your theft of all the territory in your empire showcases your greed. You know that will catch up with you eventually, right?

Your recent trend of buying land near us is concerning. For the sake of our future relationship I advise that you be cautious in this matter. Now that that's out of the way, what brings you here today?
I've heard many stories of your powerful military. The villains of this world would be wise to fear your might.
Your empire's great wealth is the envy of it's many foes.
There would be no point in discussing any matters with you; I have a Rome to reforge, and you have a second city to settle.
Just between you and me, your military is kind of the laughing stock of the world. Don't let that get you down though, I'm sure someone will put you out of your misery soon.
Ah, the bloodthirsty one shows his face. And what business does he have with me?
I believe you would be a vital ally on my path to restoring the glory of the Roman empire. What do you say to a Declaration of Friendship?
It has come to the attention of my court that a Declaration of Friendship with you is in the best interests of my efforts to restore the Roman empire.
Would you agree to a Declaration of Friendship with the future Roman empire?
I have no intentions of making myself known as your friend.
No. You would only cause me trouble.
Friend, I have a serious matter to discuss. My relationship with {1_CivName} has broken down, and I need you to denounce them as a show of support. What do you say?
You are too much to bare. I would let the world know that you displease me.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])

You have proven to me that you are incapable of dignity. The others must know that you cannot be considered a peer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Your idle gestures mean little to me.
Empty words. You haven't the gall to put them into action.
Ahhh, I've noticed that you've become friends with {1_CivName}. Glad to hear of it. I'm already on good terms with them myself.
I recommend that you not get too close with {1_CivName}. If so... we might have problems getting along.
I'll have you know that {1_CivName} and I have worked together in the past, and I have the utmost respect for them. Just so you're aware.
Glad to hear there are others in the world that share my disgust with {1_CivName}. They are clearly not to be trusted.
Being on such good terms, I couldn't help but notice that you'd become friends with {1_CivName}. I have done the same. Perhaps this makeshift alliance will lead to great things in the future?
I share your convictions that {1_CivName} only causes problems for the civilized empires of the world. Perhaps the combination of our denouncements will teach them a lesson.
Oh great, now the vermin are breeding. Now I have to deal with both you and {1_CivName}? I'll have to teach them a lesson.
Anyone who you don't get along with is clearly worth building a friendship with. Give {1_CivName} my regards.
I see your armies amassed near my empire. If you wish to attack then come. Don't hide in the shadows like a child.
It's come to my attention that you have a large number of Units near my borders. I request that you move them elsewhere to avoid causing undue distress to my citizens.
Your expansion efforts are an insult. Know that there will be consequences for this.
I couldn't help but notice that you seem to be expanding into lands which I regard to be mine. I request that you reconsider this.
The aggressive manner in which you buy up territory near us is an insult. I had hoped you would be a better neighbor.
Your purchase of land in my vicinity has caused some alarm. I caution you so that this issue does not become more serious.
My disagreements with {1_PlayerName:textkey} have become too much to bear. This is a situation that can only be resolved on the battlefield. Will you join me, friend?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} stands in the way of Rome's return. Will you assist me in vanquishing them?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} is a threat to the stability of this world. The time has come to deal with them once and for all. Will you assist me in this effort?

It's come to my attention that you're getting a little friendly with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. In case you weren't aware, they're within my sphere of influence, and I'd prefer if you stayed out of it.
Must I repeat myself? The answer is still no.
Very well. But do not stray too closely to me.
I shall not concede to these ridiculous demands.
I have prayed that you will be striken dumb and lame and with worms, so be on the look out for that.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
I thought you might like to know that your army is a little on the weak side. Better watch your back.
With an army so weak it's a surprise your empire hasn't succumb to a barbarian invasion.
Our words are backed with nuclear weapons!
It's a shame there are some leaders in this world who have their fun by picking on the weak. Don't you agree?
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It's come to my attention that your empire appears to be quite puny. Did you forget to expand your borders or are you just having a little trouble with that?
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
What a sad sight... your empire is so uncultured. What do your citizens do all day, beat rocks together?
Rumor has it that your culture is so laughable that even the barbarians are shying away from your lands.
My people have demanded that I seek out a particular resource, which you so happen to possess.
Let peace persist through an arrangement between our two empires.
You fool. You have made a terrible mistake.
I am not surprised.
Then I will take this opportunity to reclaim what is mine.
Rome is not yet lost. I shall prove my right to be her emperor, and push your armies back.
Your day of judgement will come.
You have stood in the path of my restoration for too long. It is time that you be knocked down.
I am not surprised by this move. No matter, I shall see to it that your empire becomes a part of my own soon enough.
A victory against you shall prove to my people that I have been christened by God to restore Rome to her former glory.
You have built your empire atop Rome. I shall see to it that those lands return home.
Your lands belong to Rome, and you know this.
It is my destiny to reunite the east and the west, beginning with your capitulation.
Peace only when you are willing to see reason.
No. You hold precious Roman territories that belong to me.
I see it as my duty to defeat you. There can be no peace just now.
Our people are now visiting your basilicas and studying your civil law codes. I am worried the rest of the world will soon yield to the eerie ways of your empire.
We are glad to see that your people are visting our basilicas and studying our civil law codes. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
